item.title: Flytipped Gas Cylinders - Nitrous Oxide, 27th April
item.description:
The location is the Burnt Oak Cross Roads off Aggs Hiill / Cotswold Way/ Cleeve Common Road. The flytip consists of probably empty small Nitrous Oxide Cylinders in cardboard boxes. One of the Photographs pinpoints the exact location by the actual Burnt Oak Tree. Please can these be collected as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hayden Lane - super hazard, 26th April
item.description:
This road is a total nighmare. Potholes every where. People weave their cars (mine included) around them trying to avoid. Just for goodness sake, resurface the whole lot. I very nearly got wiped out on my bike by cars and when I went there in my car, see the problem. Gutters half filled... ripples. High hedges.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Replacement sign misleading., 26th April
item.description:
Hi. A missing sign has been fitted, but now reads as confusing. This is on an Electric Charging point, but when you read the sign it looks like it is for residents only which is incorrect. There should be 2 hours for all to charge EV, or residential ‘EV’ parking. The road is marked Electric Vehicles Only, yet non-EV’s parked in the charging spaces as well

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Sheldons Court, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree and lamppost toppling, 25th April
item.description:
Tree and lamppost both overrun with ivy and very unstable. Causing danger and obstruction to pedestrians and children using alleyway. Located behind number 7 Hazebrouck Close and backing onto end of Denbigh road and the steps leading from there to the alleyway to lakeside school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Hazebrouck Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: 104 has dug up the gtass verge, its now heavily planted with spikey shirbs and trees, there is a small one foot strip left of grass, with the busy road and buses some cars are forced to park half on the pavement to allow bus access. Now in this are of welch road the public are forced on to the road, if more then 1 pedestrian wishes to past. Ive also witnessed mobility scooters un able to pass and also being forced into the road. It also blokes the view for exciting drivers to pull safe off their own drives., 25th April
item.description:
104 welch road Cheltenham, directly outside on the public highway, grass verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Welch Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole road is full of deep pot holes!, 25th April
item.description:
The potholes are outside number 8 Salamanca but there are a significant number of small but deep potholes from 4 Salamanca- 12 Salamanca. The potholes are damaging our tyres and making it a struggle to get on and off our driveway, they are also a big risk to the disabled and elderly who tend to use their wheelchairs/ mobility scooters on the road as they can’t always use the pathway but they get stuck in the holes. The whole road needs resurfacing as it didn’t get done when Imjin road and Ladysmith road got resurfaced. The road a dangerous hazard!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Salamanca Road, Oakley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
